file_content.text: We've got it under control. Just mopping up now.
Lord Tytonus's invasion has been stopped.
And Lord Tytonus herself slain. Word is already spreading across Dromund Kaas.
I am sure she is seething and already making plans for her escape.
We'll never be able to prove Lord Grathan was behind the transmissions that allowed her invasion, but it doesn't matter.
Everyone who matters knows the truth, and Grathan is already losing influence and followers.
If you're happy, I'm happy. Shall we settle up?
Not interested. Credits?
Of course. Here you are. Another time, then.
Grathan attempts to gain influence through pointless scheming, but a lightsaber destroys the best laid plans.
Politics are for fools.
The game of Sith is fun, especially when you are on top.
Delighted to have helped.
As you say, my lord.
Intelligence will know what went on here within the hour.
I'll make a full report.
Appreciated, agent.
Goodbye, be well.
You've done something amazing today.
I won't be back.
Of course. We should be able to take it from here.
Over the last three days, a series of transmissions left Dromund Kaas and were received by ships orbiting a nearby asteroid.
These transmissions contained safe landing coordinates for the planet's surface and security codes to bypass the orbital defenses.
Captain Isen told us the basics.
We know all this.
I've already heard most of this from Captain Isen.
I know all this.
The question is, who's behind the invasion?
Of course, I just wanted to be thorough.
Are we at war? Have the Jedi finally landed?
Is it the Republic?
Even the Jedi don't have the temerity to attack Dromund Kaas itself.
Then we should move.
Just so.
Several hours ago, small shuttles built to avoid sensor detection began to land and deliver troops to the planet's surface.
These troops are brutal alien mercenaries of the exiled Lord Tytonus. Students of Sith politics will remember she was the rebel who declared her own kingdom on Begeren.
There is only one ruler of the galaxy and that is the Emperor.
Then she is a traitor.
Which is why Lord Tytonus must be brought to heel.
I have to assume the Dark Council did not look favorably on such a declaration.
And thus her exile?
You follow exactly.
A Sith who declares herself queen seems like she'd be worth more than a few credits.
Sounds like a major bounty.
Truly a prize in any hunter's collection.
I thought that Captain Isen said Grathan was behind this.
What about Lord Grathan?
It may be that Lord Grathan gave her the information, but it's not his army landing.
That is such a good idea. Note to self: Find planet to conquer.
I want my own kingdom!
Preferably not this one. We have our hands full already.
There's a very simple solution to this problem. Lots of blood.
Let's kill them all.
It seems a foregone conclusion.
Lord Tytonus has judged her timing perfectly.
With so many of our forces off-planet, it is possible she could take Kaas City if she lands her entire mercenary army.
We must stop her shuttles from landing and beat back her forces. I've thrown every resource I have down there already, now it's up to you.
Major Shellaster? Captain Isen asked me to come by. He was under the impression we were being invaded.
Captain Isen was right. Paranoia paid off.
I am here. Where is this invasion Captain Isen was so sure was happening?
It's happening, my lord, and how.
You in charge? Captain Isen seemed to think you could use an extra gun.
We could at that. Welcome aboard.
Reporting in, Major. I hear rumors of invasion forces. How can I help?
Glad to see you, all of you.
You couldn't have come at a better time, agent.
Check in with Captain Isen near the city gate if you want to help. He's trying to figure out what is going on here.
